ISSUE.TITLE: Instagram dates do not include timezone offset
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: It looks like Granary is displaying dates from Instagram feeds as UTC, but then not including the timezone offset. (I'm using the Instagram to HTML conversion). It should either explicitly set the `+0000` or `Z` offset if it's converting to UTC, or if it knows the local time then set that offset instead. (XRay looks up the timezone for the photo's location and converts it to a local time, but you might not want to do that.)
